NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE VICE PRESIDENT
DuPont Circle Office Building
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N. W.
Washington 6, D. C.
22 March 19 61
Dr. Samuel L. Becker, Director
Division of Television, Radio, Film
Television Center
609 10th Avenue
Iowa City, Iowa.
Dear Sam:
We are setting up plans for the 1961 NAEB convention which will be held
here in Washington.
Following the suggestion made by you and others we want to devote one
general session to the presentation of top-notch papers on important
subject, presented by men who are authorities in their fields and who
will command the respect of the audience.
I would guess that we will want to have, say, four such papers presented,
and we would like your ideas for specific subject matter to be covered
and suggested persons to prepare and present such papers. I know that
your basic interest might be in the research field, and we will undoubtedly
want at least one paper from that area. However, you will probably be
able to come up with other topics and authorities, too, and it is for that
reason that I am writing to you.
The persons we get should very likely be outside our own ranks, don't you
suppose? I am also asking Vernon Bronson, as chairman of our NAEB
Professional Development Committee, for suggestions as to topics and speakers.
Since arrangements for such things take quite a bit of time, I would appreciate
your writing me as soon as convenient. If there are some of the persons you
have in mind whom you know well enough to contact for us, please so indicate
so that we will have that information should we decide on one of those persons .
Thanks a lot, and it was good to see you, even briefly, when you were in our
HEH:jph
Harold E . Hill >
Administrative Vice President
